q: SKY PRESENTERS APOLOGISE FOR SEXIST COMMENTS Sky football presenters Andy Coulson Gray and Richards Richard Keys have been suspended by Sky Sports after being caught by an open microphone making off-air comments about lineswoman Sian Massey at the Wolves-Liverpool game on Saturday. Somebody better get down there and explain offside to her, Richard Keys said. "Can you believe that?" Gray responded. "A female linesman. Women don't know the offside rule." The pair later apologised, but will not be on hand to present

Allen Iverson 's biggest assist to Chris Webber didn't come on a no-look pass. It came in words of encouragement to Philly's slumping newcomer. "Just get your swagger back," Chris Webber said Allen Iverson told him. Reggie Jackson 's really what I did. It helped me out. Chris Webber had his best performance in his four games with Philadelphia, scoring 24 points and grabbing 12 rebounds, and Allen Iverson added 31 points to lead the 76ers to a 98-89 win over the James Cleveland Cavaliers on Friday night

scandal at one of Britain's sauciest tabloids. The aide, Andy Coulson , had edited News of the World, Britain's biggest-selling Sunday newspaper, until 2007 and soon after was hired by David Cameron . Unfortunately, continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in this role, Andy Coulson said. President Bush Dick Cheney of State Colin Powell says he is voting for Barack Obama . "He has both style and substance. I think he is a transformational figure," Colin Powell said on NBC's "Meet the Press." Barack Obama displayed a steadiness. Showed intellectual vigor. He has a definitive way of doing business that will do us well, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell , a retired US general and a Republican, was once seen as a possible presidential candidate himself.
